basics.name: Madhura Pawar
basics.label: ELLIS PhD Candidate, University of Amsterdam
basics.summary: My research focuses on fairness, cooperation, and collective action in evolving social networks, as part of the ERC-funded RE-LINK project. I develop computational models for responsible link recommendation algorithms that promote socially desirable outcomes while maintaining user engagement.

projects.name: Mitigating Betweenness Centrality Disparities in Link Recommendation
projects.description: Studied betweenness-centrality group fairness in link recommendations and proposed two random-walkâ€“based methods that reduce structural disparities while preserving utility.

projects.name: Fairness in Link Prediction Through Active Learning
projects.description: Designed an active learning loop that steers the link recommender algorithm (Node2Vec) to generate links so that minorities are well-represented in the social network.

projects.name: Animal Social Network Visualization
projects.description: Devised an interactive dashboard that quantifies and visualizes the social structure and evolution of animal social networks over time. Predicted future links on adding new nodes using the Variational Graph Auto-Encoder model.

projects.name: Assessing Long Range Graph Benchmark Datasets
projects.description: Explored and implemented alternative approaches in mitigating Long Range Interactions (LRI). Improved the performance using E(n)-Invariant and E(n)-Equivariant algorithms.

projects.name: Hitting 'Probe'rty with Non-Linearity
projects.description: Reformulated the design of non-linear structural probes making its design simpler yet effective. Designed a visualization framework for qualitative assessment of predicted dependency trees.
